@hachikuji addressed your comments, and fixed unit tests.

Also another observation is that we are unnecessarily sending multiple txn marker requests to a single broker for txnIds from different txn topic partitions, I have grouped them into a single request as well in this PR. cc @dguy

Yes I'm having a look
@ijuma Thank you for the fixes and merging this one.

@mimaison, it's not clear to me how this can happen. Since we are producing messages with acks=-1, the producer only gets a response after the data has been replicated. And we need at least two fetch requests from the follower for the leader to know that the data has been replicated. The follower initialises `ReplicationBytesIn` while processing the response from first fetch request. Hmm.
Oh, it's probably min.isr.
Yes that's probably it, sending a new PR now

I was holding off submitting my PR, but since it's been a while and we need to fix this ASAP, I did it now:

https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3033

@ijuma I just submitted a PR too #3034 
Your changes are a lot more contained whereas we updated the settings for the whole class. Looking at the other tests, we made a couple of tweaks to fix/improve them as changing the ISR setting exposed a few issues
The other tests don't require min.isr right? So, why are we setting at the class level?
Yes it's true that they don't require it, so maybe let's merge your PR and I'll follow up with the improvements for the other test in another one
Sounds good, thanks.

@ijuma Thank you for the review. 

I think it is better to keep `ClusterConnectionState` and `ChannelState` separate even though there is some overlap. It makes it easier to follow the code.

The warning in `handleDisconnection` is triggered when a connection to a bootstrap server is broken after the connection was established. The new warnings in this PR are for
1. misconfigured broker - connection could not be established
2. misconfigured security - authentication did not complete

I didn't want to remove an existing warning just in case it was useful. For broken connections, we do have debug logs. Do you think that is sufficient?
LGTM

@rajinisivaram I see, the `handleDisconnection` warning is useful if there is a broker error that causes a disconnection (e.g. unsupported API version) although it seems less useful now that we do version negotiation. It may be worth adding a comment, but we can probably keep it for now.
